newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Mongolia seeks Indonesian help in energy sector.
newsitem.headline: Mongolia seeks Indonesian help in energy sector.

text.p: Mongolia and Indonesia agreed on Tuesday to improve economic relations, with Mongolia particularly keen for help in the oil and gas sector, Indonesian State Secretary Murdiono said.

"Mongolia has asked Indonesia to join economic development in Mongolia, especially in exploration and exploitation in the oil and gas sector," Murdiono told reporters after talks between visiting Mongolian President Punsalmaagiin Ochirbat and Indonesian President Suharto.
Ochirbat said prelimanary surveys showed that oil reserves in Mongolia were between three to six billion barrels contained in 21 blocks.

"The oil reserves have been divided into 21 blocks and there are foreign companies engaged in six blocks," Ochirbat said. "That means the rest of the 16 blocks are open for foreigners to come and to cooperate on the basis on the principle of production sharing."
"Both leaders are determined to develop economic relations and trade between the two countries with the signing of a joint declaration on principles of relations and cooperation," Murdiono said.
Indonesian Foreign Minister Ali Alatas said the signing of the joint declaration laid the basis for general relations between Indonesia and Mongolia, including economic ties.
Ochirbat arrived in Indonesia on Monday and will visit the resort island of Bali, east of the main island of Java, on Wednesday before flying to New Zealand.
